text:
EFL Tour de Force Manchester City star Yaya Toure not planning to speak to other clubs despite being out of contract in six months 
Toure will focus on finishing the season at the Etihad while Pep Guardiola considers offering a new deal By MARTIN BLACKBURN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments YAYA TOURE says he has no plans to talk to any other clubs before the end of the season. 
The Manchester City midfielder, 33, is into the final few months of his Etihad contract — and now free to open negotiations elsewhere. Getty Images 4 Yaya Toure has six months left on his contract at the Etihad 
But boss Pep Guardiola hinted last month there could yet be a new deal for the long-serving Ivory Coast star. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And Toure insists his focus will purely be on City between now and the end of the season. 
Asked if he would now be speaking to other clubs, Toure said: “No, I won’t do that. My focus is on City. 
“For now, the future is there because the league is not finished. Me and the guys are always focused. That’s the main point. Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says he's approaching end of his coaching career 
“Yes, I think I’m looking young. I think it’s going well. But I want to help my team-mates.” 
If his seven-year stay at the Etihad is to finish this summer, he is still hoping it could have a fairytale ending. PA:Press Association Pep Guardiola will consider offering Toure a new contract AP:Associated Press The Ivorian lifts the 2014 Premier League title Getty Images 4 Man City moved within seven points of top spot after beating Burnley 2-1 
The former Barcelona star has already won two Premier League titles with City as well as lifting the FA Cup once and the League Cup twice. 
City put their defeat at Liverpool behind them and went within seven points of the top by beating Burnley on Monday. 
And Toure added: “We are starting the second half of the season now and I think we will have to be almost perfect. Player of the Weekend : Yaya Toure was in fine comeback form for Manchester City Related Stories Pep Talks Pep Guardiola speaks to NBC: Man City manager's interview where he claimed his 'goodbye has already started' N'ZONZI SOS Pep Guardiola lining up £25million bid for Steven N'Zonzi to solve Manchester City's midfield crisis Sagna in hot water Bacary Sagna is ordered by FA to explain his '10 against 12' post following Manchester City's win 'second-tier team' Pep sees Man City as Premier League also-rans... on a par with La Liga side Villarreal, journalist pal claims ASK THE REF, NOT ME Watch flustered Pep explain that he has to learn rules in England - and insist he is 'happy' despite sending off super sub Man City 2 Burnley 1: Sergio Aguero fires winner for 10-man City after Fernandinho is sent off yet again HEAT ON PEP Awkward, angry and twitchy: Pep Guardiola was so cool when he came to England, but his mask has slipped 
“We’ll have to win all the games when we play the top four. 
“The lads, the fans, the manager we all understand that. 
“This year we will try to do our best to get there.” Manchester City fans sing hilarious Yaya Toure song after he scores two at Crystal Palace Man City star Yaya Toure in Robotic Dance-off with an actual UBTECH robot
